intro: Hypolytrum glomerulatum, commonly known as the clustered spike-rush, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, spike-like clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Hypolytrum glomerulatum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
